intro: Lycoctonum barbatum, commonly known as the beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Lycoctonum barbatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
